intro: Agalmyla longistyla, commonly known as the long-styled agalmyla, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Agalmyla longistyla is often found in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial shade. Its distinctive long styles in the flowers make it a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts.
